column9: I was diagnosed with juvenile myoclonic epilepsy at the age of 17 and started taking 250 mg of Depakote ER 3x day. After some issues with my menstrual cycle, my medication was briefly switched to phenobarbital (briefly due to the fact that I had severe mood swings and nausea) before switching back to Depakote. After starting college, I began to wake up dizzy, my neurologist believed I was having seizures in my sleep and the dosage of my medicine was increased to 500 mg 2x day. For several years, the dosage remained the same.  Over the last three years, though, I have begun to experience tonic-clonic seizures so the dosage is now 750 mg 2x a day. I feel tired and generally lethargic most of the time. Rarely do I ever feel energized. Over the last 14 years, I have noticed a decrease in my memory, but I don't know if it's side effects of the medication, epilepsy or both. My neurologist has me take folic acid supplement in case I become pregnant and Vitamin D with Calcium supplements to prevent bone thinning. As long as I take my medication REGULARLY (I set an alarm on my cell phone so I always remember to take it exactly 12 hours apart), my seizures appear to be well-controlled although I have had two in the last six months. Those episodes coupled with the general side effects have led me to contemplate switching medications yet I'm afraid that's a "grass is greener on the other side" approach and will do more harm than good.

column9: THIS DRUG IS DANGEROUS AND MAY CAUSE DEATH!!My father has been taking Depakote for 7 years, and I believe that it has given him Parkenson's Disease.
